page.title: 10LAW AND ORDER
page.content: The Southborough police are part of 'D'Division of the Kent Constabulary. Our investigations found that their main concerns were the reduction of crime and the control of traffic especially in the busy local High Street. This year the officers have been very busy, travelling as far as Yorkshire and East Kent to deal with the miners' strike. This has put a lot of pressure on the officers left in the local area. The main problems are traffic congestion and the constant worry over the increase in burglary and the low success rate in solving burglaries.Help in this has been found in the use of neighbourhood watch schemes and the use of computers for storing and analysing information. TVS and Crime Call on Radio Kent have also helped. The local police were very helpful and friendly.
